result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Robert Badgett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>40g), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)4.
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge. To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12/31/2019. Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count three; and consecutive to any other sentence including case 12CF4185.  Credit for 135 days, 6/7/2016-10/20/2016.

superMiscConds.notes:
No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $300.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
May not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster or any body armor.
May not live where a firearm is kept.
May not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.
Comply with all child support court orders.

Complete parenting or Fatherhood course.
Mental health evaluation and any recommended treatment.
Driver's license suspension is not imposed.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  DOC must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

supervisions.notes:
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following  restrictions:  Firearm possession and voting.
The  Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).
_______________
Court advised defendant that under Wisconsin Statutes 302.113, the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended Supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Robert Badgett in court with attorney Christopher Donovan.  Defendant Christopher Robert Badgett in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. 

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS and 4 MONTHS, concurrent to Count 3 and consecutive to any other sentence, including case 12CF4185, with credit for 135 days time served (06/07/2016-10/20/2016); the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS 4 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS and 4 MONTHS, concurrent to Count 1 and consecutive to any other sentence, including case 12CF4185, with credit for 135 days time served (06/07/2016-10/20/2016); the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS 4 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12/31/2019; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $300.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Maintain full time employment. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting; Notice & Acknowledgement; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Received on behalf of the defendant and filed. LNR

Defendant Christopher Robert Badgett in court with attorney Lew A Wasserman.  Defendant Christopher Robert Badgett in custody.  Paul Hauer appeared for Karl Peter Hayes, for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI

Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

Pursuant to plea negotiations, case no. 15CF673 will be dismissed but read in. 

AS TO COUNTS 2,4 and 5:

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered counts 2, 4, and 5, dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on Motion of the State, Court ordered as a Party to a Crime, modifier stricken. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 3:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY as to Count 1 and 3, and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty of both counts and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 6/3/2016 at 1:30, branch 17. Court vacated jury trial.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
